channel.title: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte
channel.description: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte Senator, New Hampshire (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Live free or Die!
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: That's the motto of the great state of New Hampshire. But I believe tonight we all share that view ­ as have generations of Americans before us.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Like most Americans ­ our family's life changed after 9/11.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: My husband Joe ­ who was on track to be a commercial pilot ­ instead served our great country flying combat missions in Iraq.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: When he returned home from the war ­ he found himself in the same position as so many Americans ­ he needed a job.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: So he started a family business ­ a landscaping and snowplowing company.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: And when I say he ­ I mean we ­ because I spent many a sleepless night shoveling snow. And I'm proud of the fact that in addition to being a United States Senator ­ I'm also pretty good with a snow plow!
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: We are no different from most families who take risks starting their own business.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: We borrowed money to pursue our dreams. And believe me, there was no guarantee of success. We certainly were not too big to fail ­ we had to make it work.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Yet through all the hard work and sacrifice ­ we pulled together as a family. As the business grew so did our extended family.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: And I speak to you tonight with great concern ­ for our employees ­ their families ­ my family ­ and your family.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: My concern is that President Obama is making it very difficult for small businesses to get started ­ to create jobs ­ and to survive.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: I hear this all the time from the small business owners I speak with. They want to focus on their business. The Obama Administration wants to bury them with rules, regulations and red tape.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: From the National Labor Relations Board ­ to the Department of Labor ­ to the EPA.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Under this Administration, the regulations are up ­ and the job creation is down.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: President Obama's view is clear: he actually believes that as a family business grows ­ the federal government should take a larger share of its earnings.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: That's punishment for expanding and creating more jobs.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: I call it a "success tax."
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: And the very best example is Obamacare.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Let me tell you what I hear in the real world about Obamacare.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Just a couple of months ago ­ a successful restaurant owner in Concord, New Hampshire, told me about his dilemma. He wanted to open up a second restaurant ­ and hire more employees.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: But he realized that if he did ­ he would trigger penalties under Obamacare and he couldn't afford it. So he never opened up that restaurant.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Is that what we want for small businesses in America ­ to be afraid to grow because of the government? To face penalties when you create more jobs?
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: To be told "you're earning too much"?
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Isn't it time we had a leader who believes that creating jobs ought to be celebrated not penalized?
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: That is why Mitt Romney is running for president.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: He'll get the federal government out of the business of small business.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: He'll fight to lower and simplify taxes.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: He'll work to eliminate job-killing red tape.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: And he will roll back Obamacare starting on Day One!
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: In both the private sector and as Governor of Massachusetts, Mitt Romney always asked: how can I help small businesses grow, innovate, and compete?
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: It's the right question. And it's the question that this Administration never thinks to ask.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: But why should we be surprised? President Obama has never even run a lemonade stand ­ and it shows.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: So what we need to do is clear. For the sake of the future of small business ­ we need to replace Barack Obama.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: We need to replace Barack Obama with Mitt Romney. A man who truly gets it.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Mitt understands the hopes and dreams of small business owners throughout our great country.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: But don't just take my word for it. I want you to hear directly from someone on the front lines of small business.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Jack Gilchrist is a small business owner from Hudson, New Hampshire.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Three generations of his family have used their own hands to build Gilchrist Metal Fabricating. It's a true family business ­ founded over 30 years ago by Jack's father ­ and carried on by Jack and his son.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte

item.title: Jack Gilchrist is the face of small business in America, and yes he did build it. Please join me in welcoming my friend Jack Gilchrist.
item.author: The Hon. Kelly Ayotte
